question: can you recount your actions after the dinner party?
answer: Jay made a vague gesture. "I was around. I'm sure you want a... what are the called? Alibi? I'm rairly part of the in-house staff, however. After setting up the flower arrangements for dinner, I spent most of the time replanting grown seedings here and trimming the topiaries on the lawn."

question: do you know who owns this gun?
answer: "I honestly couldn't say. Everyone 'round here seems to have one, you know." He rubs the back of his head, "I have one. Mind you, it's just for shooting at rabbits-- they tend to make themselves a nuisance in the garden. Haven't ever turned it on a person. Unless you consider vacuum cleaner sales men people."

question: can you explain why you were at the manor?
answer: "When you're as old as I am, you gotta start work before the heat gets to you. 6am everyday for the past ten years. I tend to have more early mornings and late nights than I used to, but I don't mind too much. Ain't much else I'd rather be doing, anyways. "

question: were you and dr. mallard on good terms?
answer: "I've been here... a lifetime, pardon the turn of phrase. In 40 odd years you learn a lot about a person-- not everything is something you like. Most of it isn't. I've put decades of work into this place, though, and I would be damned if I let that get taken for me over a spat. Most people are like bees: you don't bother them and they won't bother you."
